edu.umw.cpsc.humantrafficking
Class HumanTrafficking

java.lang.Object
  sim.engine.SimState
      edu.umw.cpsc.humantrafficking.HumanTrafficking
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
public class HumanTrafficking
extends sim.engine.SimState
implements sim.engine.Steppable

A simulation of global human trafficking; specifically forced prostitution. Notes on Scheduling:

  • The time for this simulation is in years. (i.e., if the current time step is 0.5, that represents July 1st, 2013.)
  • This object will run once per year, on Dec. 31st, incrementing the value of getYear() so that objects scheduled to run immediately hereafter will see the new year.
  • For other scheduling information, see start().

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

instance

public static HumanTrafficking instance()
Singleton pattern.

start

public void start()
Begin the simulation, including everything necessary on the schedule. In particular:
  • Each Route will run on Jan 1st of every year (including this year, immediately after this method concludes).
    • When routes run, they will acquire Victims, and those victims will run on July 1st of every year.
  • The StatsPrinter will run on Dec. 30th of every year.
  • This object itself will run on Dec. 31st of every year.

Overrides:
start in class sim.engine.SimState

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Run this simulation "headless"; i.e., without a GUI.

getLocations

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,Location> getLocations()
Return a hashtable of locations that embody this simulation. The keys of the hashtable are location names (Strings), and the values are corresponding Location objects.
